com.worizon.jsonrpc

Class Rpc

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.worizon.jsonrpc.Rpc

  • public class Rpc
extends Object
    Facade class to make remote procedure calls to JSON-RPC 2.0 compliant servers. This facade class can be consumed via the proxy api and via the direct api (the set of methods named as callX). To use the proxy method to make rpc calls your interface must be annotated with the @Remote annotation. There exists some other annotations apart from @Remote to tweak and adjust the remote procedure behaviour to your needs. Following you can find the list of annotations that can be used to modify the behaviour of the resulting rpc stub object:
    • @RemoteProcName
    • @RemoteParams
    • @LocalExceptions
    • @LocalException

    Some examples using the proxy api:

    Ex1: 

     @Remote (Notice the annotation)
 interface MyRemoteInterface{
                
        public Void doTask();
 };
 
 Rpc rpc = new Rpc("http://myserver.mydomain.com:4444/rpc");
 MyRemoteInterface service = rpc.createProxy(MyRemoteInterface.class);
 service.doTask(); //==> blocking call to the remote procedure

    Ex2: 

     @Remote
 interface MyRemoteInterface{
                
        public int sum(int x, y);
 }
 
 Rpc rpc = new Rpc("http://myserver.mydomain.com:4444/rpc");
 MyRemoteInterface service = rpc.createProxy(MyRemoteInterface.class);
 int result = service.sum(3,4); //==> parameters ordered by position {params:[3,4]}

    Ex3: 

     @Remote
 interface MyRemoteInterface{
                
        @RemoteParams({"x","y"})
        public int  sum(int x, int y);
 }
 
 Rpc rpc = new Rpc("http://myserver.mydomain.com:4444/rpc");
 MyRemoteInterface service = rpc.createProxy(MyRemoteInterface.class);
 int result = service.sum(3,4); //==> parameters ordered by name {...,params:{x:3,y:4}}

    Ex4: 

     @Remote
 interface MyRemoteInterface{
                
  @RemoteProcName("my_sum")
  public int sum(int x, int y);
 }
 
 Rpc rpc = new Rpc("http://myserver.mydomain.com:4444/rpc");
 MyRemoteInterface service = rpc.createProxy(MyRemoteInterface.class);
 int result = service.sum(3,4); //==> parameters ordered by position {method:"my_sum",params:[3,4]}

    There exists another way to make remote invocations, the direct api. The direct api uses variable arguments (Object...) to supply the parameters to the remote procedure. The direct api is suposed to be used as a delegated object inside your service implementation: 

     public class MyService{
        
  private Rpc rpcDelegate = new Rpc("http://myserver.mydomain.com:4444/rpc");   
 
  public int sum(int x, int y){
        
   return rpcDelegate.callInteger("my_sum",x,y);
  }

    Some examples using the "direct call" api:

    Ex5: 

     Rpc rpc = new Rpc("http://myserver.mydomain.com:4444/rpc");
 int result = rpc.callInteger("sum",1,2,3,4,5);

    Ex6: 

     Rpc rpc = new Rpc("http://myserver.mydomain.com:4444/rpc");
 rpc.callVoid("doTask");

    Ex7: 

     Rpc rpc = new Rpc("http://myserver.mydomain.com:4444/rpc");
 int result = rpc.callInteger("sum",Rpc.RemoteParam("op1", 4),Rpc.RemoteParam("op2", 5)); //==> parameters ordered by name {...,params:{op1:4,op2:5}}

    Ex8: 

     Rpc rpc = new Rpc("http://myserver.mydomain.com:4444/rpc");
 short[] ids = rpc.callShortArray("get_ids");
    Since:
    1.0.0
    Author:
    Enric Cecilla

      • Rpc

        public Rpc(String endpoint)
    throws MalformedURLException
        Instantiates a new facade Rpc object.
        Parameters:
        endpoint - Remote procedure endpoint String.
        Throws:
        MalformedURLException - When the remote url is not valid: bad protocol, bad url syntax.

    • Method Detail

      • createProxy

        public <T> T createProxy(Class<T> clazz)
        Creates a proxied interface to call remote procedures. ex: 
         _@Remote
 public interface ICalculator{
                int sum(int x, int y);
 }
 ICalculator calculator = Rpc.createProxy(Icalculator.class);
 int result = calculator.sum(4,6);//blocking call
        Parameters:
        clazz - The interface to be proxied.

      • call

        public <T> T call(String method,
         Map<String,Object> params,
         Class<T> clazz)
       throws IOException,
              InterruptedException
        Calls the remote procedure and serializes the result JSONRPC field into an object of the class clazz.
        Parameters:
        method - The remote procedure name to be invoked.
        params - The params that will be passed into the remote procedure as a JSON object.
        clazz - The class to turn itno the result field.
        Returns:
        The result field deserialized as a T object.
        Throws:
        IOException
        InterruptedException

        Parameters:

        params - The params that will be passed into the remote procedure as a JSON array.
        clazz - The class to turn into the result field.
        Returns:
        The result field deserialized as a T object.
        Throws:
        IOException

      • addRuntimeExceptionMapping

        public void addRuntimeExceptionMapping(int code,
                              Class<? extends RuntimeException> exception)
        Adds a mapping between exception class and error code. When the code error code arrives the exception exceptionwill be thrown.
        Parameters:
        code - The JSON-RPC code error.
        exception - The exception to be thrown, this exception must extend RuntimeException.

      • RemoteParam

        public static Map.Entry<String,Object> RemoteParam(String paramName,
                                   Object paramValue)
        Helper factory method to create a parameter (name, value) pair.
        Parameters:
        paramName - Name of this parameter.
        paramValue - Value of this parameter.
        Returns:
        The pair of (paramName, paramValue) as an object of type AbstractMap.SimpleEntry
